newsitem.title: INDIA: India Reliance raises $150 mln debt.
newsitem.headline: India Reliance raises $150 mln debt.

text.p: India's Reliance Industries Ltd raised a $150 million 30-year loan at an interest rate of 7.625 percent per annum through a private placement with European investors, a company spokesman said on Friday.
In a statement later the company said: "Reliance has made a private placement of $150 million (5.4 billion rupees) debt to a group of sophisticated European institutional investors".
The debt has a final maturity of 30 years with an innovative rolling put structure consisting of an initial put option in the 10th year followed by put options at five year intervals.
The deal was arranged by Lazard CreditCapital. The sole underwriters are Credit Agricole Lazard Bank of U.K, the statement said.
The deal is unsecured debt issue without any guarantee from government, banks or financial institutions.
Reliance said the private placement deal was concluded on the phone, without any roadshows.
"Reliance set record of sorts by raising $405 million from international investors in 72 hours during the week, a feat unparallelled in Indian corporate history," it said.

On July 22, Reliance became the first manufacturing company in Asia to tap the sterling market by raising a 150 million pound sterling 10-year debt, the highest tenor achieved by any Asian company, it said.
